Package controller

Class ModifyProduct

java.lang.Object
controller.ModifyProduct
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProduct extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The AddProduct class is used to build Product objects and add them to allProducts in the Inventory class.

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Initializes ModifyProduct.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • productIntake

      public void productIntake()
      Ensures the temp Product has been initialized and if it has, ModifyProduct's TextFields are set to the values that the temp Product holds.

    • setSelectedPart

      public void setSelectedPart() throws NullPointerException
      If the TableView that is generated from Inventory's allParts list is not null, the selectedPart is set to the selected item in the inventoryPartsTableView.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException

    • setSelectedAssociatedPart

      public void setSelectedAssociatedPart() throws NullPointerException
      If the TableView that is generated from temp's associatedParts list is not null, the selectedAssociatedPart is set to the selected item in the associatedPartsTableView.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException

    • validateFields

      public boolean validateFields()
      Performs validation checks on relevant fields.
      Returns:
      true if fields are validated, false if they are not.

    • onCancelButton

      public void onCancelButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Calls closeWindow() when the user clicks the cancel button.

    • onAddAssociatedPartButton

      public void onAddAssociatedPartButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Checks to ensure the user has selected a part from the inventoryPartsTableView and, if they have, it is added to temp's associatedParts list. The associatedPartsTableView is then reset to the current associatedParts list. If the user has not selected a part, they are warned that they must select a part before attempting to add it to the associatedPartsList.

    • onRemoveAssociatedPartButton

      public void onRemoveAssociatedPartButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Checks to ensure the user has selected a part from the associatedPartsTableView and, if they have, the user is prompted to confirm the removal from temp's associatedParts list. If the user confirms removal, the part is removed from the associatedParts list and associatedPartsTableView is then reset to the current associatedParts list. If the user has not selected a part, they are warned that they must select a part before attempting to add it to the associatedPartsList.

    • onSaveProductButton

      public void onSaveProductButton(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Retrieves text from TextFields and temporarily stores it in variables. These variables are used to create a Product. After the Product is added to allProducts, Inventory.productId is incremented and the window is closed.

    • onInventoryPartsSearchTextField

      public void onInventoryPartsSearchTextField(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      If the user presses the Enter key or the TextField is left empty, an appropriate search is performed on the contents of the TextField. The contents are first checked if it contains an integer. If the contents of the field is an integer, the inventory parts are searched for a matching ID. If the contents are a String, the inventory is searched for a matching name.

    • onInventoryPartsTableViewClicked

      public void onInventoryPartsTableViewClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Calls setSelectedPart() when the user clicks on the inventoryPartsTableView.

    • onAssociatedPartTableViewClicked

      public void onAssociatedPartTableViewClicked(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent mouseEvent)
      Calls setSelectedAssociatedPart when the user clicks on the associatedPartTableView.
